metadata.name: cliques #74
metadata.description:
clique is defined as:

- /klēk,klik/ (n.) a small group of people, with shared interests or other features in common, who spend time together and do not readily allow others to join them.

cliques can offer safety. (something about numbers.)

cliques can offer a place to be. (for better or worse.)

sometimes cliques have sub-cliques. (the intersections can get a bit complicated.)

sometimes a member of a clique may still feel outside of it. (power dynamics can ruin things.)

occasionally clique dynamics are balanced and the connections between the members pull towards the center. (we can consider that non-toxic.)

often, though, the connections are pulled in various directions and the connection between two members are swayed (or pulled towards) other members. (we can consider that toxic.)

[4 color palettes: monochrome, neon, vibrant rebellion, glacier]

[tap “s” to save image]
[tip: zoom out to 25% first to save a higher res image]

[cc0] [p5js] [xoxo] [twitter: @heyjeres]

metadata.name: Furbol #255
metadata.description:
Creator: Ahmad Moussa || Gorilla Sun
Twitter: @gorillasu
Description: Generative fluffy textures programmed in p5js

metadata.name: Perpendicular Inhabitation #289
metadata.description:
'Perpendicular Inhabitation' is a generative collection exploring the relationship between the urban landscape and the human experience, particularly feelings of nostalgia and more specifically 'anemoia' : the feeling of nostalgia for a time or place that we may not have actually experienced first hand. 

Despite depicting a stylised modern architectural language, at its core the collection serves as a homage to 1980s Japan, an era of unprecedented prosperity that left a lasting impression on the music and artwork of the time. Through the use of carefully created palettes and composition, the outputs intend to evoke feelings of optimism, while guiding viewers to consider why the essence of this era is so alluring in the present day as it continues to influence and inspire contemporary art.

The use of exaggerated perpendicular verticals, as well as the heavily foreshortened mountain ranges present in some outputs, convey a sense of hope and possibility for the future. What does it feel like to hope and dream in the city? To look up and be filled with a sense of wonder from the built environment around you?

This project has been created with print in mind at a ratio of 3:4

It is recommended to examine your outputs at full size in order to enjoy them to the fullest.

You are encouraged to return often to notice things you may not have seen previously.

Generated with code using p5.js

Images are generated at 2400 x 3200 px. 

To save a PNG file, please press 'S'.

Depending on the complexity of each output, please wait up to 10 seconds for the image generation to complete.

metadata.name: NeuralFaces #596
metadata.description: NeuralFaces is an AI-driven avatar collection based on a neural network that was trained on face sketches. The latent vector for each face is generated from the transaction hash.

metadata.name: Illusion of safety #40
metadata.description: Metallic, the closed space illusion murmurs inside.

metadata.name: Life has no scores #133
metadata.description:
We cannot compose life, at best we hum along to the melodies that life has been played in front of us. Looking back at the scores of our lives, the notations are never neatly noted, but fully felt.  Rewinding the songs of life are our memories, whether sad, happy, angry, or melancholy. It is not clear whether I am dreaming or awake, but our songs all do end. 

In this final drop (for ?), I have reused the first ever class calligraphy(){} I have written from my genesis drop “Nothing comes from nothing”. As time passes, 10 drops later, across almost to the year, I am grateful for the progress I have made, as an artist, and more importantly as a human. After all, what is behind the code of generative art is a human being. 

Scores of music, scrolls of calligraphy, calendar or diary, notating life, time passes, and changes are inevitable. Sometimes we sing louder in laughter and joy, sometimes we scribble in uneasiness, sometimes we just get lost in neon lights. Life goes on. You and me, all the same and yet different.  

There are too many friend artists, friend collectors, fxhash team members, to thank for helping me through this journey. I would like to pay homage to Rudxane in this work, who has taken me under his wings, mentoring and encouraging me in art as well as showing me some degen stuff on the side:-). This homage is not copy-minting, or copying of styles, which I do not have the coding skills to do so even if I wanted to. But it is the influence of taste in many works of Rudxane. In a vague but agreeable taste, I present to you Life has no scores. 

What I was taught was disrupted, and grid studies left unfinished, and oh do we have a BINGO?

Tested on Chrome. Other browsers may render different or not at all (firefox)

Press ‘2’ to save png.

Copyright (©) 2022 Jimi Wen
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: SCHNEEWALD #132
metadata.description:
SCHNEEWALD is the second release in a row of about 12 tree/flower generative art works, which have come together over the last 10 years.

This project explores an approach to trees with snow using a recursive algorithm and includes Three traits: a density layer for the amount of trees and another layer for the amount snow and a third for how strong the branches bend.

Rendering progress indicated on the top left border
Press [s] in live view to download a high resolution png

Artist notes:
Since I moved to Wandlitz, north of Berlin, in the middle of the "Naturpark Barnim" (https://www.barnim-naturpark.de/), in 2003,
I've done a lot of exploring nearby nature. In addition to the beautiful lake and heath landscapes, I fell in love with the wild acacia forests. These strange trees, sometimes more like huge wild grasses, grow so wildly into each other.

I experienced it in all sorts of seasonal change, packed with snow is definitely among the most amazing! 

While playing around with different branching system code snippets, a more and more complex image composition came together. The final script for this project on fx(hash) was finally given more randomness for a wider range of different outputs and an additional random grain filter.

Project link: https://e-art.co/project/schneewald/

Many thanks to jesse (jbird) for the good collaboration, which ultimately made it possible to get this work released.

copyright © 2023 | license cc 4.0 BY-NC-ND

metadata.name: A mere matter of ornament #214
metadata.description: Geometrical Abstraction by @ge1doot

metadata.name: energomorphy #35
metadata.description:
Energomorphy: Form in Energy.

This generative system emerged from a technical process as I implemented a particle system within my GPU-based GIF painting workflow. While allowing for the free and independent movement of each particle, I aimed for the system to remain controlled, deterministic, and capable of seamless looping. Encapsulating these particles within animated geometric shapes opened a window for observing energy flows and kinetics as forces that shape ever-evolving forms.

The shapes that constitute us and surround us are primarily composed of void. Within this spatio-temporal domain, particles are treated as objects, while the energy field serves as the true subject. Interactions between the color fields of the agitated particles create an ever-revolving game of light that outlines ephemeral shapes, in the present, making them appear and dissolve.

In this space between geometry, organic forms, and fluid, rhythmic motion, we can perceive heartbeats, flowers, cosmic structures, and more, while meditating on the forces that make life a constant within the impermanence of matter.


This work is animated and can be resized and exported as a seamless looping GIF. As the density and dynamics of the particles depend on the display size, the aesthetics change with the size of the canvas.


Features and Interaction
- Pause & Menu Access: Click on the animated painting to open the menu. Click again on the painting to hide the menu and restart the animation.
- Size: Define the frame size, then confirm by clicking OK to apply the change.
- GIF Export: Save the current animation as a GIF.
- Frame Navigation: Move between frames with the < X / Y > selector.
- PNG Export: Save a snapshot of the current frame as a PNG.
- Sync: Synchronize multiple screens using webRTC (highly experimental with challenging user experience; intended for the adventurous).


Energomorphy was created and developed by Nico in 2024 using a custom-crafted codebase that incorporates various open-source libraries:
- Generic libraries (wgpu, winit, wasm-bindgen, etc.) for working with Rust in the browser and GPU.
- Stefan Gustavson's psrdnoise WGSL implementation.
- Matt DesLauriers's gifenc JS library for encoding GIFs.
- Eli Grey's FileSaver JS library for downloading files.

Copyright © 2024 Nicolas Arbogast
(See the LICENSE file included for details and contact information.)

metadata.name: Sano #45
metadata.description:
Using Coronado’s algorithm as a starting point, Sano extends and embraces the notion of beauty existing in imperfection but allows for more impressionistic compositions with less structure, letting something atmospheric and understated emerge with subtle interactions that combine into dissonant chordal expressions infusing a breadth of emotion while maintaining a characteristic timbre.

Just as Coronado referenced a beat-up vintage guitar that had a patina and sound all its own, Sano refers to the vintage amp it was plugged into. A tube-amp from the 1960s with a spring reverb that when combined with single coils and hollow body of the guitar delivered screaming feedback as well as wonderfully gritty warm tones, which this algorithm attempts to echo visually.

There are 100 artist curated outputs in this short-form collection.

Keys:
S : save at current resolution
1 → 6 : save 2000x2500 → 12000x15000
(Chrome recommended for higher resolutions)

metadata.name: Flower Arrangement #107
metadata.description:
Flower arrangement made by code.

Possible features:
- Style: Natural, Oval, Triangular, Grassy
- Orientation: Square, Portrait, Landscape
- Palette: White, Cream, Tan, Pink, Green, Blue, Yellow, Orange
- Primary flower: Mix, Gerbera, Gerbera 2, Dahlia, Dahlia 2, Spiky, Unknown
- Primary color: Random, Light, Dark
- Secondary color: Random, Light, Dark
- Vase shape: Cylinder, Tumbler, Round, Curve
- Dish: true, false
- Table: true, false
- Texture: true, false

Live view options:
- Press "s" key: Saves the high resolution image (3300 x 3300 for square, 4200 x 3300 for portrait, 3300 x 4200 for landscape)

Depending on the device you run it on, it may take some time for the drawing to complete.
Best viewed in larger window size.
Made with p5js.

August 2022
ykxotkx

metadata.name: Traffic Jam #8
metadata.description:
Welcome to Daily Fury Road, where you'll encounter heavy traffic ranging from modern vehicles to classics.

Press S to capture a screenshot of the scene. Additionally, you can play or pause the music by simply clicking on the image.

Pixel art and chiptune sound by P1.
Code by n0t4numb3r.
